sense.gloss: to use (a tool, method, etc.), to make use of, to put to use
to use (a person, animal, puppet, etc.), to employ, to handle, to manage, to manipulate
to use (time, money, etc.), to spend, to consume
messenger, bearer, errand boy, errand girl
use, usage, user, trainer, tamer, charmer
way of using (something), way to use, how to use, usage, use
way of handling (employees, subordinates, etc.), way of treating, treatment, management
use, exercise (of one's right, authority, power, etc.)
using freely, making full use of, having a good command of
labour and management, labor and management
proper use, using (different things) for different purposes
to handle (men), to master (a tool), to manage, to acquire a command of (a language)
purpose for which money is spent, the way money is spent, how goods are used
to use properly, to use (different things) for different purposes
envoy, diplomat below the rank of ambassador (e.g. deputy chief of mission, charge d'affaires), minister (of legation)
to use up, to exhaust, to wear out
messenger, bearer, errand boy, errand girl
ease of use, user-friendliness, usability, utility, convenience
to be usable, to be serviceable, to be useful
police and judicial chief (Heian and Kamakura periods)
klesha (polluting thoughts such as greed, hatred and delusion, which result in suffering)
waste (of money, time, etc.), squandering, frittering away
consideration (for), thoughtfulness, solicitude, care, watchfulness, concern, sympathy
old kana orthography (used before 1946 reform), historical kana orthography
to send, to dispatch, to despatch
to bestow (favour, etc.), to grant (e.g. pardon)

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑天使↑↓てんし↓のような↑人↑↓ひと↓だ！
sdata.e: You're an angel!

sdata.j: あぁいらいらする・・・↑今↑↓いま↓やパソコンを↑使↑↓つか↓うたびに↑頭痛↑↓ずつう↓がするよ。
sdata.e: So annoying... Now I get a headache whenever I use the computer!

sdata.j: このような↑辞書↑↓じしょ↓には、「↑冷蔵庫↑↓れいぞうこ↓」という↑言葉↑↓ことば↓を↑使↑↓つか↓った↑例文↑↓れいぶん↓が↑少↑↓すく↓なくとも2つは↑載↑↓の↓っているはずだ。
sdata.e: In a dictionary like this one there should be at least two sentences with "fridge".

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓が↑六↑↓ろく↓↑歳↑↓さい↓のときタイプライターの↑使↑↓つか↓い↑方↑↓かた↓を↑学↑↓まな↓び、↑手↑↓て↓で↑書↑↓か↓くことを↑学↑↓まな↓ぶ↑必要↑↓ひつよう↓などないと↑先生↑↓せんせい↓に↑言↑↓い↓った。
sdata.e: At the age of six he had learned to use the typewriter and told the teacher that he did not need to learn to write by hand.

sdata.j: ↑国王↑↓こくおう↓はいつも↑自分↑↓じぶん↓を↑褒↑↓ほ↓めるおべっか↑使↑↓づか↓いにうんざりしていたので↑彼↑↓かれ↓らを↑遠↑↓とお↓くへ↑飛↑↓と↓ばした。
sdata.e: The king was tired of his sycophants always praising him, so he sent them away.

sdata.j: ↑勝手↑↓かって↓に↑何↑↓なん↓でも↑使↑↓つか↓って。
sdata.e: Make yourself at home.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑暴力↑↓ぼうりょく↓↑行使↑↓こうし↓を↑正当↑↓せいとう↓↑化↑↓か↓することができますか。
sdata.e: Can you justify the use of violence?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑辞書↑↓じしょ↓の↑使↑↓つか↓い↑方↑↓かた↓を↑知↑↓し↓っていますか。
sdata.e: Do you know how to use a dictionary?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑辞書↑↓じしょ↓の↑使↑↓つか↓い↑方↑↓かた↓を↑学↑↓まな↓ぶべきだ。
sdata.e: You should learn how to use your dictionary.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑新↑↓あたら↓しい↑車↑↓くるま↓を↑使↑↓つか↓ってもよい。
sdata.e: You may use my new car.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓のヨットを↑自由↑↓じゆう↓に↑使↑↓つか↓ってよい。
sdata.e: You are welcome to the use of my yacht.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はなぜお↑金↑↓かね↓を↑使↑↓つか↓い↑果↑↓は↓たしたのか。
sdata.e: Why did you use up all the money?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はなぜお↑金↑↓かね↓をすべて↑使↑↓つか↓い↑果↑↓は↓たしたのか。
sdata.e: Why did you use up all the money?

sdata.j: どっちのベッドを↑使↑↓つか↓いたい？
sdata.e: Which bed do you want to use?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓はこの↑車↑↓くるま↓を↑使↑↓つか↓ってもいい。
sdata.e: You can use this car.

sdata.j: ↑電話↑↓でんわ↓を↑使↑↓つか↓ってもいいですか。
sdata.e: May I use your phone?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑奥↑↓おく↓の↑手↑↓て↓を↑使↑↓つか↓うときが↑来↑↓き↓た。
sdata.e: The time has come for you to play your trump card.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓の↑鉛筆↑↓えんぴつ↓を↑使↑↓つか↓ってもいいですか。
sdata.e: Can I use your pencil?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓のおかげで、↑全↑↓ぜん↓↑財産↑↓ざいさん↓を↑使↑↓つか↓っちゃったよ。
sdata.e: Thanks to you, I spent all my money.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓が↑使↑↓つか↓った↑金額↑↓きんがく↓は↑全部↑↓ぜんぶ↓でいくらですか。
sdata.e: How much money did you spend in total?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓が↑使↑↓つか↓ったお↑金↑↓かね↓↑全部↑↓ぜんぶ↓を↑説明↑↓せつめい↓できますか。
sdata.e: Can you account for all the money you spent?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓が↑使↑↓つか↓ったお↑金↑↓かね↓の↑全部↑↓ぜんぶ↓を↑説明↑↓せつめい↓できますか。
sdata.e: Can you account for all the money you spent?

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓が↑寄付↑↓きふ↓するお↑金↑↓かね↓は↑立派↑↓りっぱ↓に↑使↑↓つか↓われるだろう。
sdata.e: The money you give them will be put to good use.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓がどれだけ↑本↑↓ほん↓に↑使↑↓つか↓ったか↑計算↑↓けいさん↓して↑見↑↓み↓てください。
sdata.e: Try to estimate how much you spent on books.

sdata.j: どれだけ↑本↑↓ほん↓に↑使↑↓つか↓ったかを、ざっと↑計算↑↓けいさん↓してみてください。
sdata.e: Try to estimate how much you spent on books.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓がそんなにお↑金↑↓かね↓を↑使↑↓つか↓うとはあきれるばかりだ。
sdata.e: It is outrageous that you should spend so much money.

sdata.j: ↑空↑↓あ↓き↑部屋↑↓へや↓が↑３↑↓みっ↓つあるが、そのうちのどれも↑使↑↓つか↓えない。
sdata.e: We have three spare rooms, none of which can be used.

sdata.j: ↑空↑↓あ↓き↑部屋↑↓へや↓は↑三↑↓みっ↓つありますが、どれも↑使用↑↓しよう↓できません。
sdata.e: We have three spare rooms, none of which can be used.

sdata.j: ↑金↑↓きむ↓は↑善↑↓よ↓い↑召使↑↓めしつかい↓だが↑悪↑↓わる↓い↑主人↑↓しゅじん↓だ。
sdata.e: Money is a good servant, but a bad master.

sdata.j: ↑金↑↓かね↓は↑使↑↓つか↓っても↑使↑↓つか↓われるな。
sdata.e: Money is a good servant, but a bad master.
